skillTree.localised_description: This Tyrant is the size of several large creatures rolled into one. In fact, he ate those several large creatures just yesterday.
A small handful of Gnoblars surround this Ogre Lord, their swords always ready to cut and carve.
Stumpy and short-witted as they are, these Gnoblars have an eye on the sky at all times.
It never hurts to keep your lucky Gnoblar with you, just in case.
Puny magicks are nothing in the face of the Great Maw's endless hunger.
A Bellower’s voice is as deep as it loud, carrying across the battlefield and encouraging unbridled carnage.
"The Great Maw protects and the Great Maw devours. Hiding in shadows, the meatbags cower!"
Snapping limbs and smashing skulls – it's all in a day's work for an Ogre Tyrant.
Rule number one of being a leader is to be far more terrifying than the next braggard who thinks they ought to take your place.
It is not enough to impose military defeat upon the foe, they must be brought to their knees through punitive taxation… unless they'd rather get in the meat-pot instead?
Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +20%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +35%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +50%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: A mighty harpoon, pinning the enemy to the ground until it can no longer resist.

ui_effects.localised_text: Requires line of sight to the target

skillTree.localised_description: As Sharktooth's most fearsome monster hunter, Targog prides himself on tackling the most dangerous beasts face to face.

Targog's crew of Ogre sailors have always hunted the biggest and the baddest of the ocean deeps, even the mighty Merwyrms. They haven't caught one yet, but they've been practicing their craft for many years.
There's nothing a captain needs more than a good crew... or at least a few good officers.
Letting the prey get away because you got tired, why, that's just a failin' as a captain.

related_attributes.bullet_text: Even when performing the most fatiguing actions, this unit never loses vigour.

skillTree.localised_description: The great creatures of the sea might have size on their side, but intelligence is oft lacking.

attributes.bullet_text: When this unit gets hurt it may go on a rampage against nearby enemy units, attacking the closest one and ignoring any orders given.

skillTree.localised_description: No enemy is immovable when in the path of a furious Ogre's charge.
Although precision in missile combat is something that can be learned, this one was born with a high degree of natural talent.
This Ogre's greed shall never be sated, for his stomach is as endless as his hunger.
A truly sturdy armour is needed to hold such an overflowing gut in place.
"Dark Magic might be effective, but there's no substitute for a good blade in your hand."
This traditional trapper's tool is a noose made from wire; if the foe struggles, it simply tightens, cutting into the flesh.
If the enormous size of this Ogre doesn't incite terror, his bloody, malevolent smile surely will.

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.

skillTree.localised_description: Silent, swift and very, very deadly, this one can take down the foe from range without breaking a sweat or revealing his position.
Hand-to-hand combat is a lethal match of cut and thrust. However, it’s not all about offensive strikes; parries and other defensive moves can also win the day.
Only the foolish go on the hunt without supplies and a cast-iron plan.
Bears, Orcs, Kroxigor - prey-size is not a hindrance to the master hunter.
There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +75
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: When an Ogre charges, the ground itself begins to quake. As it should.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +2 for Ogre Bulls units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +4 for Ogre Bulls units

	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +12 for Ogre Bulls units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Though their intelligence is as pitiful as their physique, one would be a fool not to fear the Gnoblars when massed in numbers.

effects.description:
Melee defence: +2 for Gnoblars units
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +4 for Gnoblars units
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +6 for Gnoblars units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: If there's one thing more horrifying than being rushed by a hulking, bloodthirsty beast, it's being rushed by that same creature riding on the back of another equally hulking, bloodthirsty beast.

effects.description:
Weapon strength: +6% for Mournfang Cavalry and Crushers units
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +9% for Mournfang Cavalry and Crushers units
	(Lord's army)

	(Lord's army)

	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +12 for Mournfang Cavalry and Crushers units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The Ogres' true firepower is as destructive and indelicate as the Ogres themselves.

	(Lord's army)

Ammunition: +12% for Leadbelchers, Gnoblar Scraplauncher and Ironblaster units
	(Lord's army)

	(Lord's army)

Missile strength: +8% for Leadbelchers, Gnoblar Scraplauncher and Ironblasters units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Even ferocious brutes like the Ironguts and Maneaters fight harder in the presence of a worthy leader.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +2 for Ironguts and Maneaters units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +4 for Ironguts and Maneaters units

Melee defence: +4 for Ironguts and Maneaters units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +6 for Ironguts and Maneaters units
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +6 for Ironguts and Maneaters units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: What the monstrous creatures of the mountains lack in guile, they more than make up for in their stubborn reluctance to die.

effects.description:
Charge bonus: +4 for Sabretusk Pack, Stonehorns, Gorgers and Giant units
	(Lord's army)

Armour: +9 for Sabretusk Pack, Stonehorn, Gorgers, and Giant units
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +8 for Sabretusk Pack, Stonehorns, Gorgers and Giant units

	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +12 for Sabretusk Pack, Stonehorns, Gorgers and Giant units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: To the most brutal, vicious killer go the richest spoils.

effects.description:
Armour: +10 for Ironguts, Gnoblars, and Ogre Bulls units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Leadership: +6 for Ironguts, Gnoblars and Ogre Bulls units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +12% for Ironguts, Gnoblars and Ogre Bulls units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: When pelting a helpless enemy with heavy projectiles is so much fun, why bother stopping?

effects.description:
Speed: +10% for Gnoblar Trappers, Leadbelchers, Gnoblar Scraplauncher and Ironblasters units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Range: +10% for Gnoblar Trappers, Leadbelchers, Gnoblar Scraplauncher and Ironblasters units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Reload time reduction: +15% for Gnoblar Trappers, Leadbelchers, Gnoblar Scraplauncher and Ironblasters units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: When fearsome, brute strength is combined with terrifying speed, the petty weaklings among the enemy can only wet themselves in fear.

effects.description:
Leadership: +5 for Mournfang Cavalry, Crushers, Stonehorn and Sabretusk Pack units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Speed: +10% for Mournfang Cavalry, Crushers, Stonehorn and Sabretusk Pack units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +7 for Mournfang Cavalry, Crushers, Stonehorn and Sabretusk Pack units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Driven by ravenous hunger, the Maneaters feast on the flesh of the fallen.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +7 for Maneaters, Gorgers and Giant units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +10% for Maneaters, Gorgers and Giant units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Missile resistance: 15% for Maneaters, Gorgers and Giant units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
One can never go hungry on a long march for as long as there are captives for the meat-pot.

effects.description:
Attrition: -10% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -20% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -30% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Even Ogres are capable of forward planning, especially when it comes to precious loot.
Raiders are good at marauding through enemy settlements - sending their denizens fleeing as their properties are despoiled.
Ravagers are merciless - they will sack an enemy settlement, take everything and kill any that get in their way.
Someone has to ensure the numbers and quality of recruits remain high.
"The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.localised_description: A good quartermaster can ration equipment and foodstuffs efficiently, making supplies last longer.
Those that excel as looters make sure that every coin or gold tooth is found and added to the plunder. Woe betide the warrior that misses even a single copper token!
The grumblings of unrest tend to quiet when under threat of being crushed and eaten.
This Lord's many deeds - both on and off the battlefield - have brought them renown among their allies and made them feared by their enemies.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +25% chance of wounding aggressors

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
When attacking braced charge defenders, this unit only loses half of its charge bonus.
Allows the unit to attack and destroy walls in melee.

effects.description:
Campaign movement range: +10% while at sea
	(all armies)

Leadership: +4 when fighting at sea
	(all armies)

Bonus vs Large: +5 when fighting at sea
	(all armies)

Immune to High Seas, Reef and Storm attrition
	(all armies)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Targog is a fearsome warrior, and one who specializes in defeating the greatest dangerous of the deeps. He has even swum after a whale and clubbed it to death, hence his name. After that display of strength, his tribe has never seen fit to challenge him.

effects.description:
Campaign movement range: +10% while at sea
	(Lord's army)

Growth per region: +10 after winning a battle
	(all provinces)
